comment: Here is the weirdest, but one of the best parts of this film, is usually when they have a secret mission, the mission gets discovered by the antagonist and it becomes usually the big climatic event, will the antagonist foil the plans of the hero.  Well in this film the secret mission, finding the trident never get's spoiled.  Most movies just lean on spoiling the plans of the hero, where this one dismisses it.  It's sorta like the movie is done when he grabs onto the trident.  Ocean Master becomes a little problem at that point.

comment: Roy Orbision song, written by Bono.  The night before a concert in London, Bono couldn't sleep, so he played "In Dreams" from the Blue Velvet soundtrack until he drifted off.  When he awoke, he had a song in his head.  He played it for the band backstage, who remarked that it sounded like a Roy Orbison song.  Then, who comes to meet the band backstage at that moment?  Roy Orbison.  They collaborated on Roy's final album.
